intro: Linanthus harknessii subsp. condensatus, commonly known as the denseflowered linanthus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its dense inflorescence and narrow, linear leaves. It typically thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. This plant plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
